definition[0]: to mention something as an example, especially one that supports, proves, or explains an idea or situation
example[0]: The judge cited a 1956 Supreme Court ruling in her decision.
example[1]: Several factors have been cited as the cause of the unrest.
definition[1]: to give the exact words of something that has been written, especially in order to support an opinion or prove an idea
example[2]: The passage cited above is from a Robert Frost poem.
definition[2]: to order someone to appear before a court of law
example[3]: Two managers had been cited for similar infractions.
definition[3]: to mention someone by name in a court case
example[4]: Sue was cited in the divorce proceedings.
definition[4]: to mention someone because they deserve praise
example[5]: Garcia was cited for her work with disabled children.
definition[5]: to mention something as an example, especially in order to support, prove, or explain what you are saying
example[6]: The report cites the case of Sweden, where following the liberalization of the postal service, around 1,000 new jobs were created.
